relation_surface: cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature
rel_desc: Variations in temperature cause cyclic stresses in metallic components.
resolution_context: Direction chosen from cause (temperature variations) to effect (cyclic stresses).
justification: The text explicitly states that cyclic stresses are caused by variations in temperature.
evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature.
canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a direct cause or primary driver of the object within the context of thermal fatigue phenomena.

relation_surface: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses
rel_desc: Cyclic stresses lead to the damage mechanism known as thermal fatigue.
resolution_context: Thermal fatigue described as the result (effect) of cyclic stresses (cause).
justification: The phrase 'Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses' indicates a causal relationship.
evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature.
canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a direct cause or primary driver of the object within the context of thermal fatigue phenomena.

relation_surface: Damage is in the form of cracking
rel_desc: Thermal fatigue damage manifests as cracking in metallic components.
resolution_context: Thermal fatigue (damage mechanism) expressed via its damage form (cracking).
justification: The text describes the damage from thermal fatigue as 'in the form of cracking'.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: DamageForm: cracking is the typical manifestation of thermal fatigue

evidence_excerpt: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component
canonical_rel_desc: Links a damage mechanism or underlying phenomenon to its typical observable manifestation or damage form.

relation_surface: cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component
rel_desc: Cracking due to thermal fatigue can occur anywhere within a metallic component.
resolution_context: Direction from the damage (cracking) to the host (metallic component).
justification: The phrase 'may occur anywhere in a metallic component' specifies where cracking appears.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Extent: location of cracking is not restricted to specific regions

evidence_excerpt: cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained
canonical_rel_desc: Links a phenomenon or damage event to the physical component or region in which it occurs.

rel_desc: Constrained relative movement within a metallic component contributes to the occurrence of cracking.
resolution_context: Relative movement (when constrained) is framed as a condition under which cracking occurs.
justification: Cracking is said to occur where relative movement is constrained, implying it is a contributing condition.
remark: Relation chosen to capture that constrained relative movement is a condition promoting cracking.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FailureContext: thermal fatigue cracking sites are associated with constrained relative movement

evidence_excerpt: cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained

rel_desc: Constrained differential expansion in a metallic component promotes the occurrence of cracking.

rel_desc: Repeated thermal cycling particularly promotes or aggravates cracking due to thermal fatigue.
resolution_context: Repeated thermal cycling is given as an operational condition under which cracking occurs.
justification: The phrase 'particularly under repeated thermal cycling' modifies where cracking occurs, implying that such cycling intensifies or favors cracking.
remark: Direction chosen from loading condition (repeated thermal cycling) to damage (cracking).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: SeverityContext: repeated cycling increases likelihood/severity of cracking

remarks: Direction chosen from loading condition (repeated thermal cycling) to damage (cracking).

rel_desc: Repeated thermal cycling inherently involves variations in temperature over time.
resolution_context: Thermal cycling is generally understood as repeated temperature variations; not stated explicitly but strongly implied by terminology.
justification: Although not spelled out, 'repeated thermal cycling' in this context reasonably denotes repeated temperature variations that drive thermal fatigue.
remark: Relation added with lower confidence; primarily to connect the cycling process to the underlying temperature variations.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ConceptualLink: thermal cycling consists of successive temperature variations
